author: Philipp
title: imToken wallet integration
description: Cardano needs more mobile wallets in the Asian market.

assessments.note:
The problem statement doesn't make sense, why does Cardano need more mobile wallets in the Asian market? There is no information to explain this need in the proposal. YOROI is an official Cardano wallet and already offers support to the Asian public. In addition, Cardano already has support in several wallets, so why should we spend treasury resources to fund the inclusion of ADA in ImToken wallet? What would be the benefits?

More details are needed to understand how this proposal can address the challenge.

This company says they support "imToken is an easy and secure digital wallet trusted by millions. It supports BTC, ETH, EOS, TRX, CKB, BCH, LTC, DOT, KSM, FIL and many other crypto assets. It also allows you to exchange token and use decentralized applications right from the wallet." Why do they need he community finds? Looks fishy.They can go to the market

The proposal addresses the challenge with previous experience working with multiple cryptocurrency coins available. Why would a working platform need 200,000USD to list Cardano into its assets? More clarity as to the use of the funds proposed to launch a listing in Imtoken. The proposal can potentially benefit the community by onboarding new markets in Asia but as the technology grow in the Cardano network it would be of detriment of Imtoken not to list a top tier coin launching a wide array of Dapp and Defi applications in its network.

Adding more options to cardano ecosystem is definitely a desirable thing. However, this proposal is just at the concept/wish stage and lacks a lot of workable elements in the rest of the departments. It has only few sentences to a reference of actual mobile wallet provider but that's about it. Would have loved to read more about interoperability, maybe ways how this can be brought to Cardano ecosystem.
The proposal is not clear on it's solution on how to bring additional users to cardano. it is not clear how ADA will be used with ImToken.

There is no description of a plan for implementing the proposal. It is not clear whether the proposer is part of ImToken, nor is there any detail about the proposer's professional experience or skills. I recommend that the proposer provide these details so that we can evaluate the proposal.
No information provided on how they will use the $200,000 that they request, just to add ADA to their wallet.

Given the experience the platform has the knowledge to make this listing a possibility. I don't understand the funding prescribed to apply the solution. More clarity needs to be communicated to determine to what ends is the requested funds used for.

There isn't much information on the individuals behind this proposal. Understanding team and having some references/links of profiles or past work would have been very desirable. Presently, there really isn't anything that we can work with. Also - there seems to be arbitrary budget of 200,000 USD listed but no actual break down why and what for. Those added details would have been useful to understand.
The proposal does not provide examples of previous work or any credibility to the project team. There is no clear information that supports completion of the project.

There is insufficient information to assess the feasibility of the proposal or how it will address the challenge. The inclusion of a new wallet by itself is not enough to meet the challenge, we need to understand the importance of this and what is the differential of having ImToken as another option, mainly due to the fact that YOROI and DAEDALUS are already efficient wallets and they have advanced native features that are not present in wallets that offer general support for multiple cryptocurrencies.
The proposal give no information on use of $200,000 they request. No timeline, no reason why this major corporation needs Community funding.

There is not much information to the proposal to make a accurate assessment as to the solution proposed. No plan highlighting the funds used and stages required to solve the challenge highlighted within an existing platform with other top tier coins.

Because this reads more like a suggestion or concept stage idea - there really isn't any meaningful roadmap, milestones, success metrics, challenges, risks. There are a lot of elements missing that would make it easier for community to understand this proposal and where it wishes to go. I suggested added this depth into proposal and trying to resubmit at later stage if it doesn't get funding this time around.
the proposal does not provide and metrics to judge success of the project or any goals that the project might have.

solution: imToken is a mobile wallet that can support Cardano, with a huge user base in the Asian markets, with focus in China.
experience: 1 million monthly active users on iOS and Android. Founded in 2016, headquarters in Singapore, Hangzhou, Taiwan.
